channel.title: Wireframing on Leon Barnard's Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Wireframing on Leon Barnard's Portfolio

item.title: Wireframing for Everyone
item.description: Wireframing for Everyone demystifies UI design through wireframes, by stripping away the decorative layer so that anyone can learn to construct a digital product and make it easy to use. Get it free.

item.title: Five Steps to Creating Great Wireframes
item.description: Good wireframes solve real problems and lead to strong products. From writing out the scenario to gathering inputs, here is a proven path to a great website or app.

item.title: How to Start a Wireframe Project
item.description: Four techniques to start a wireframe project from scratch and ensure that you dedicate enough time to the ideation phase, where the success of your product begins.

item.title: How to Use Wireframes with Design Systems
item.description: An alternative to pushing wireframes beyond their limits is to keep them low fidelity and let another tool do the work of specifying the look and feel.

item.title: UI vs. UX: A Culinary Comparison
item.description: This article will combine storytelling with analogy to approach the subject of explaining UX differently.

item.title: Wireframing for Beginners
item.description: Wireframing is an essential skill for UX Designers and other experience design participants. Learn how to get your wireframing off to the right start.

item.title: Tips for Presenting Your Wireframes
item.description: Once you’re done with your wireframes, you’ll need to present them to get someone’s approval. Learn 3 effective strategies to get buy-in and move forward.

item.title: 3 Steps to Better UI Wireframes
item.description: If you're new to wireframing, or are looking to level up your wireframe game, these steps should help you get the most out of the wireframing stage.

item.title: Using Wireframes with Agile User Stories
item.description: A step-by-step guide on how to use wireframes in your Agile User Stories. Tips: add just enough detail and focus on what developers really need to know.
